abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority defends itself against audit released by New York State Comptroller Thomas P DiNapoli, which raised concerns about authority's efforts to reduce trash and rats in subway system; audit was released day after video of rat dragging pizza in subway station went viral, which illustrates difficult task of cleaning up subways.
lead_paragraph: Thomas P. DiNapoli, the state comptroller, questioned a pilot program that removed trash cans from 39 train stations, saying it has shown little evidence of reducing rodents or litter.

headline.main: ‘Pizza Rat’ Prompts a Collective ‘Ew’ and Debate on Cleaning New York Subway
headline.print_headline: Pizza, an Ambitious Rat and a Debate on Trash

snippet: Thomas P. DiNapoli, the state comptroller, questioned a pilot program that removed trash cans from 39 train stations, saying it has shown little evidence of reducing rodents or litter.
